title: How to Make Sausage Bread Rolls

steps.headline: Place a bread slice on your board and roll a wooden roller over it.
steps.description: This will make bread slices thin so that they do not break while making rolls. You can remove the sides of bread slices if you don't like it.

steps.headline: Try to roll the bread slice to check if they break or not.
steps.description: After all the bread slices are flat and thin enough, keep them aside.

text: Place a bread slice on your board and roll a wooden roller over it. This will make bread slices thin so that they do not break while making rolls. You can remove the sides of bread slices if you don't like it. Try to roll the bread slice to check if they break or not. After all the bread slices are flat and thin enough, keep them aside. Take a fry pan and add 1 tbsp of cooking oil. Instead you can use olive oil, it is a more healthier option. Place the sausages in the fry pan one-by-one. If you're using frozen sausages, leave them aside till they are at room temperature. Fry the sausages till they are cooked properly. Home-made sausages take a little longer to cook then frozen sausages. Once they are done, keep them aside. Cut the tomatoes and capsicums into thin, long slices. Remember to remove the seed part. In a separate fry pan, add a tbsp oil and add the slices of tomatoes and capsicums into it. Stir fry them. While frying, add vinegar, soy sauce, crushed chili powder, freshly grounded black peppers and a pinch of salt. Fry them for a 2-3 minutes. Now place a flattened bread slice, put the tomato and capsicum mixture in the mid-line and place a sausage over it. You can also put 2-3 sausages per slice if you wish. Add grated cheese on the top. Slightly roll the bread from one side towards the center and then roll over the other side. Serve your  sausage bread rolls with chili-garlic sauce. Enjoy!
